Class Hotel

java.lang.Object
Hotel
public class Hotel extends Object
The Hotel class essentially captures a hotel that contains information about its name, room capacity, and the Rooms and Reservations themselves. The Hotel class should be able to give their monthly earnings as it is something that is specific to the Hotel itself. The Hotel class also has the responsibility to set its own pricing for every Room, its own name, and its capacity.

  • Constructor Details

    • Hotel

      public Hotel(int roomCount, String hotelName)
      Constructs a Hotel object that includes the name of the Hotel and the initial capacity of the Hotel.
      Parameters:
      roomCount - initial capacity of the Hotel. roomCount must be from 1-50 for it to be considered a valid input
      hotelName - name of the Hotel. hotelName must fall under the naming convention of no spaces to be considered valid.

    • Hotel

      public Hotel(String hotelName)
      Constructs a Hotel Class that specifies the name of the Hotel. The room capacity is set to 1 by default.
      Parameters:
      hotelName - name of the Hotel. hotelName must fall under the naming convention of no spaces to be considered valid.

  • Method Details

    • getMonthlyEarnings

      public double getMonthlyEarnings()
      Gives the monthly earnings of the Hotel by going through price of all the Reservations that Hotel has for the month.
      Returns:
      the total computed monthly earnings of the Hotel

    • getRoomList

      public ArrayList<Room> getRoomList()
      Gives the roomList of the Hotel.
      Returns:
      roomList of the Hotel

    • getReservationList

      public ArrayList<Reservation> getReservationList()
      Gives the reservationList of the Hotel.
      Returns:
      reservationList of the Hotel

    • setNumberOfRooms

      public boolean setNumberOfRooms(int roomCount)
      Sets the room capacity of the Hotel.
      Parameters:
      roomCount - roomCount must be from 1-50 to be considered a valid input
      Returns:
      true if roomCount is from 1-50, false if otherwise

    • setNewPrice

      public boolean setNewPrice(double newPrice)
      Sets a new price for all Rooms in the Hotel.
      Parameters:
      newPrice - newPrice must be greater than or equal to 100.00 to be considered a valid input
      Returns:
      true if newPrice is >= 100.00, false if otherwise

    • getHotelName

      public String getHotelName()
      Gives the name of the Hotel.
      Returns:
      name of the Hotel

    • setHotelName

      public boolean setHotelName(String newName)
      Sets the name for the Hotel.
      Parameters:
      newName - newName must follow the naming convention of no spaces to be considered a valid input
      Returns:
      true if newName followed the naming convention, false if otherwise
